notes.note: Priority given to COMM majors; CALS seniors, juniors then sophomores. All others by permission only. Students must attend the lecture they wish to add to get on a waitlist. Priority given to Comm majors; CALS seniors, juniors, then sophomores .

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Science Writing for the Mass Media

notes.note: Not open to freshmen. Prerequisite: college-level writing course.
Prerequisites: introductory psychology or COMM 1101 or 2200. One evening mid-semester prelim.
Prerequisites: COMM 2450 or instructor's permission.
Prerequisite: COMM/INFO 2450
Prerequisites: COMM 2450 or instructor's permission.

Work component and variable. 1 credit; may be repeated once for a total of 2 credits. Prerequisite: COMM major or minor (first-, second-, third-, or fourth-year) for 1 credit (minimum 60 hours). Enroll through form available in 170 Roberts Hall.
1-3 credits; may be repeated to 6 credits with different supervising faculty member. Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).

1-3 credits; may be repeated to 6 credits with different courses. Intended for undergraduates desiring classroom teaching experience. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing; 3.0 GPA (2.7 if teaching assistant for skills development course); permission of faculty member who supervises work and assigns grade. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).
1-3 credits; may be repeated to 6 credits. Prerequisites: senior standing; 3.0 GPA. Students must register using independent study form (available in 140 Roberts Hall).

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Independent Honors Research in Social Science
course.class_descr: Ind Honors Res in Soc Science

notes.note: Prerequisite: undergraduate standing; requirements me for honors program. Staff. Intended for students pursuing the research honors thesis in Communication. Students must complete the CALS Honors program application by the third week of the fall semester of their senior year. Students should select a faculty advisor and begin proposal development during their junior year.
Prerequisite: communication graduate students or permission of instructor.
Recommended: familiarity with basic statistical concepts.
